learning-objectives.text: Describe the nature of business and the role of accounting in business
Articulate basic business concepts
Understand and visualize the relationship among revenue, costs, and profitability
Classify business transactions into account categories
Define commonly used business accounts and identify each as one of five account types
Classify accounts as either temporary or permanent based on the category each falls into
Present the accounting equation and define each component of the equation
Express the five account types in a mathematical equation
Describe and illustrate how net income impacts retained earnings
Record transactions and illustrate how they impact the components of the accounting equation
Determine accounts affected and the impact of common business events
Record transactions and their impact on the accounting equation in a tabular format
Describe the characteristics of an account and the concept of a chart of accounts
Articulate how accounts track increases and decreases in an element of the business
Organize and number accounts according to their classifications
Journalize transactions using the double-entry accounting system
Convert transactional events from narrative to corresponding accounts and amounts by applying the rules of debit and credit
Implement procedural steps for properly journalizing transactions
Post transactions from the journal to the ledger accounts
Transfer amounts from the journal to the ledger and maintain account balances
Identify the column (debit or credit) where each account’s balance is typically found
Prepare an unadjusted trial balance and explain how it can be used to discover errors
Transfer the running balances from all the ledger accounts onto one summary form
Verify that the total of all debit amounts equals the total of all credit amounts
Describe and prepare the financial statements of a corporation
Describe and prepare an income statement to summarize a corporation’s periodic operational performance
Describe and prepare a retained earnings statement to summarize a corporation’s operational performance
Describe and prepare a balance sheet to summarize a corporation’s financial position at a point in tim
Explain how the financial statements relate to one another
Solve for unknown amounts on financial statements using given amounts on two or more statements, the net income equation, and the accounting equation
Evaluate progress over time based on comparative income statements and present a graphical interpretation of the progress
Describe the steps in the accounting cycle of an organization
Explain why accounting is a cyclical process from period to period
Identify the sequence of events in the accounting cycle
Explain and prepare closing entries as the final step in the accounting cycle
Journalize the entry to set revenue and expense account balances to zero at the end of the accounting period
Present the ending balances from all the ledger accounts in a summary form that verifies that the total of all debit amounts equals the total of all credit amounts
